the problem is that samsung plasma technology is unreliable.
the company will only warranty this very expensive high end plasma tv for one year  which is quite telling.
my tv developed a number of rows of dead pixels going from the right to the left of the display.
this happened a few weeks after the warranty period had ended and despite begging and pleading samsung told me that i was solely responsible for the  900 cost to replace the entire plasma display.
i had to throw the tv in the dumpster..... what a waste of money.

i m not a tv expert  thus don t have similar tv s to compare...that said  picture quality is great  setup easy  i choose free ship  went from memphis tn to florida in 2 days...ty newegg...i always shop around  and i always end up buying from newegg  best     shipping cust service...packaging was quality  airbags  wrapping....when u turn on tv  no pic is displayed  till you tell the tv where input is from   fyi  tv has no buttons   all done via remote...all settings via remote are easy...there are numerous choices  for adjusting pic quality...this was a refurb...came with remote power cord quick start quide...full guide is on screen  accessible by remote...everything is functioning perfectly  wired wireless good  no flaws   all pixels good  ...this is an eggcelent tv...a superb tv...i highly recommend...i would buy 10

3 screws to mount the base not included...i believe an oversite from refurb place...2 aaa batteries not included normal  fyi edging at the top popped off and was stuck on the top of tv..had to pull edging forward which quickly went into correct fitting...i again have to suspect refurb place  as edge is very tight around tv  so very unlikely shipping did that...i did have to call visio support  they are good   some smart tv apps weren t accessible... they had me go to a onscreen tab  and select update firmware...took 10 min...these cons  are very minor and all were fixed.

this model has the most basic network connectivity software.
it can only use wpa2 less sophisticated tkip cipher type to connect to the wifi.
this means that if you have a router that downgrades the wifi security from the normal eas down to basic tkip  then your newer devices such as laptops and ipads may not connect to the internet.
also  while the tv set up was easy  the network setup was unnecessarily difficult.

it required me and vizio s tech support over 2 hours to figure out that the tv is using the older outdated network software  which most updated home wifi systems will require wifi extenders configured down to meet both your newer ipads and this vizio s network requirements.
therefore  i m returing this tv because i can t use the smart tv functions.
also  this tv uses edge led lighting with not so great graphics display software.
this means that if you use this as an external monitor  you will be disappointed with even simple things as a plain black and white word document displaying just text.
don t let others tell you that a 1080p tv can easily serve as a computer monitor.
take my lessons learned  it can t  if you want a monitor  then invest in a good monitor.
i m using the tv as a monitor for my pc.
it s connected via the adapter s hdmi port so the picture quality is excellent.
it s also connected to a roof antenna and to my cable router.

it also lacks a quam tuner so if you don t have cable or satellite  then make sure you get it a tv tuner to watch your local stations.
the remote sensor is in the bottom left corner and it makes it difficult to respond if you are a few degrees off from it   aka don t point at the center of the tv.
the remote is also a little slow to respond compared to other tvs but it s not a deal breaker.
i guess since i m so familiar with good color quality  being a cgi designer   i probably should ve followed my first thought   not purchased this tv.
but because it was the midnight madness black friday sale at the local best b y  and this tv was only 179 bucks  i figured i d give it a shot.
sheesh... so many to mention  but let s start with color.
terrible.
and when you try to adjust it  your options are washed out or over saturated.
also  the picture is dark and the contrast setting comes pre set at 100  so you can t make it any brighter.
adjusting the actual  brightness  setting just gives it a washed out coloring.
the picture is also  cloudy  looking and no matter how high you adjust the sharpness  it doesn t clear things up at all.

deep blacks  no motion blur  awesome color even with the standard settings.
a main concern of mine was how regular standard def channels displayed   and i am pleased with the results.
many  if not most flat panel hd tvs display standard def horribly   some much worse than a crt.
in some cases  the sd is actually better than crt.
minimal glare as well which is unusual for a plasma  and even less than my old crt 36 .
color and brightness not an issue even in my room full of windows and lights all the way on.
oh  and the hd   so sharp and detailed its unbelieveable.

it does swivel  so maybe it just seems loose.
hasn t been a problem though.

it does throw some heat out  but since my family room is half underground in northern michigan  it stays cold all the time  so the little extra heat is just a welcome bonus for me and less i have to run the furnace.

i bought this from a brick and mortar store because a 5 year protection plan was available.
i bought this tv to use both as a computer monitor and tv.
as a monitor the one requirement that it absolutely had to have was 4k  60hz  4 4 4 chroma subsampling.
for pc  older or less expensive uhd or hd tvs may use 4 2 2 or 4 2 0 which compress the signal.
sources other than pc don t use 4 4 4.
this tv has hdmi 2.0 which is the only version so far that can do 4 4 4.
without 4 4 4 the picture quality is less that what you would have with a regular computer monitor.
without 4 4 4  i noticed that small black text on a red backround  uneven number of pixels  and excel charts looked bad  bars had compression artifacts or ghost image surrounding them.
lines were inconsistent color .

to get it to work you need these things   a nvidia geforce gtx 900 series or amd equivalent  use only hdmi port 1 on tv  set hdmi uhd color to on  and set device type to pc  press source  select port 1  then press tools  and select device type.
once this is done the picture looks absolutely perfect.
also  dvi to hdmi cables will work  4k  60hz  4 4 4  and will work in any of the 3 other ports at lower resolutions and or frequencies.
the salesperson will try to sell you expensive cables.
he said  40 per cable was the minimum that i should spend.
you definitely do not need to buy expensive hdmi cable s  as long as they are 6 feet or less and you won t be plugging unplugging all the time.
the only requirement is that the cable be a  high speed  hdmi cable.
the free cable that came with my dvr works very well  4k  60hz  4 4 4.
however another  2.50 cable caused the pc audio and video to cut out for a second or two on rare occasion  so i used that one for my dvr  where it works good.
the colors are more vibrant than anything i ve seen before.
the framerate is interpolated to 60 hz  which i do notice sometimes.
the motion looks smoother in what is sometimes called the  soap opera effect .
the tv came with the eco sensor turned on.
it will dim the picture more in a darker room to save energy.
you can also set a minumum backlight brightness when it is turned on.
i measured that the tv uses 114 to 133 watts without eco sensor and about 39 to 44 watts with it on  but the picture is too dark imo .
it was about 73 to 74 watts with the minimum set to 5.  when playing video games on the pc  the input lag is low enough that it is not an issue at all.
some older video games sometimes  or always  crash when the resolution is set to 3840 x 2160.
i won t be using console  game mode  on this tv because i only play games on the pc.
at first i couldn t get the 4 4 4 to work because i didn t set the device type to pc.
i chatted with a samsung rep online and he didn t know enough about it to tell me that  and he wasn t even sure that it could do 4 4 4.
when i bought it  the salesman didn t seem to know either and so i almost returned it because i wasn t sure it could do 4 4 4.
the 3rd day  i figured it out on my own and all was good.

i tried hooking up my 20 year old yamaha yst m10 computer speakers  also 10w per channel  and they sounded so much better than the tv speakers that i will keep using them even though i can t control the volume with the remote control.
there is a stereo mini plug and an optical out on the back of the tv for this.

i also noticed that when using my computer the sound now comes through the hdmi cable and it is not initialized until the windows startup sound has almost finished playing  so you never hear the beginning of the startup sound.
when i first connected the tv to the internet  i couldn t get it to accept the wi fi password  so i connected the lan cable and it worked.
i later got the wi fi to work by pressing the wps button on my router  i need to use the one ethernet cable for the computer .
over the first 3 days  the tv used 2 to 3 gb of data and i only used the tv web browser for a few minutes.
so most of that data was for something unknown.
i have a 10 gb limit per month with my satellite internet service so i need to be able to easily turn wireless on and off.
i chatted with a rep and he said there is no way to easily toggle connectivity on and off.
you can disconnect easily  but to turn it back on  you have to hit the wps button on the router again.
my router has a simple button that toggles the wireless on and off  so it is easier for me to do it that way.
but i have to make sure the tv is turned off whenever i use wireless for something else.
there will be times where both will need to be on so then i will need to disconnect the tv.

to avoid some repetitions  i ll just do the hands on review about my experience of using it for about 2 months now.the device that i got is samsung t24a350.

hdmi is the connection to laptop and vga cable is connected to desktop.
my tv connection is cox cable.the monitor s performance is very similar to other brands.
what stands out  is that 2 documents can fit at once due to its larger screen.
even at 200  zoom size  the dot pixels in word document have no viewing bad effect from a distance of 1 foot away.

in internet setting  i increased it to bigger text size  to make use of unused screen spaces  and still i do not have to keep flipping the page up down button compared to small size screen experiences.the netflix tv function is sub par and i almost return it.

it works and i do not have to plug unplug the wire.
i did not notice any sound volume reduction in belkin wire too.the speed of 60 is slow and i usually noticed  freezing scenes  both in netflix and tv moods.
if you can  avoid the speed of 60.
the pip  picture in picture  will allow you to use excell word  for example  and watch tv  in smaller screen in the corners  at the same time.
i did not notice any lag using excell word and tv at the same time.
a significant system s slow down occurs when using netflix in samsung screen and excell word in my laptop screen at the same time.
maybe my 2 years old laptop is slow.
viewing netflix and tv scenes from a distance of 3 feet away  the pixels are very pronounced.
it will not escape in anybody s un trained eyes.

it means that this monitor can t be tilted and you need to remain seated.

if you prefer standing or lie backward in your seat for 2 hours watching a movie  the colors and shapes were distorted and need to be compensated  magic angled .during tv mode  its volume can t be controlled by any pc.

as good as my 6 year old samsung plasma.. pretty much.
i wanted a larger screen so i upgraded from my 58  samsung plasma to this 75  samsung 7100.
my plasma set had some bad capacittors that i have already repaired once and picture is going out again.
it was long in the tooth at 6  years old so i figured it was time to move up a size.
i am happy overall with the set because it really does have the best picture from an lcd of this size i have seen under  9 000.
i honestly have to say that if you can live with 65  or smaller  get a plasma    and keep  2 000 in your wallet.
no you won t be  fashionable  with a tiny bezel like this tv  and no it won t be as thin as a piece of toast  but it will do what a tv is suppossed to do.... display an awesome picture.
like i said  i do like this tv and the smart apps seem pretty cool although i have a full time media pc hooked up already so i can t see it replacing that anytime soon.
to get to the big sizes  70  and up  you need an lcd so that is what i did.
i also have to get used to the color differences between plasma and lcd sets so that is part of it.
i have been watching it for 2  hrs a day for 2 weeks now so i am used to it but my wife and i have the same opinion...  real nice  and huge  but no better color or picture than our old plasma .
i know this sounds like a negative review but it is not.
i am just being subjective and i know 90  of people out there have a living room where 65  or less is more than enough.
i have a freind with the 80  top of the line sharp  857  model and this is a better picture so trust me that extra 5  is not worth it  get the samsung.now some observations.....
when on a totally black screen there is what i guess they call  clouding  near the 4 corners but mainly the left side top and bottom.
it is distinctive each spot is different that the others and does not change.
you only notice it when the picture is black so i guess i can live with it since it can t be seen during normal picture  just when credits roll  etc.

but once again this is actuall pretty normal with lcd s and plasmas never have this.also when there is a guy in the dark with a flashlight  say on csi or something  you will sometimes see the gradual stepdown grey shades of shadow of that light.
i see this on all lcd s  almost never on a plasma.
the technologies are different there are inherent problems with both  for instance plasmas buzz sometimes  they get hotter  and use way more power.
also this 75  weighs  62lbs off the stand but my 58  plasma was about 95 lbs.
but felt like 200 while leaning over my mantle.
the remote has no number keys  it is real small and has a neat trackpad and voice control mic with a few key buttons for menu  smart hub  etc..
i was thrown off at first but i now like it.the tv has wireless but the worst thing you can do over wireless is try to stream video so remember that.

i have already run 2 ethernet wires for my directv and media pc but i plan to do another one for the tv since it often loses connection with the wireless n router that is about 20  away.this tv has the dual core processor vs. the 4 core in the 8000 9000 series models.
the apps seem to load just fine with the dual core so that should nt be a deal breaker for anyone.3d is viewed through 4 included active glasses that sync with the tv when turned on.
i have looked at 2 3d videos from different sources and even the built in 3d sample videos that come stored in the tv.
the 3d effect does work pretty well but i honestly have to say that there is a latent  outline shadow  on both sides of high contrast objects.
for instance the white striped center lines on the lemans racing track  samsung video  have extra outline shadows on either side of them that you can see on the black street.
this effect appears in all 3d content and all 4 pairs of glasses  so it is the tv not the source.
it is minor but definitly noticable enough to turn me off on 3d more than i already was.
i hope this helps some people with buying decisions  like i said this is a great tv and can t be beat for the money apples to apples.

i wanted to offer something other that the usual reviews that either consist of greatest tv eva    or a highly technical scientific grading of color  hue  dynamic contrast ratio  blah  blah  blah that even leave me puzzled.... and i went to electronic school.
samsung un60f7100 has amazing picture qaulity.
we are really enjoying the samsung un60f7100  it provides amazing picture clarity when viewing an hd source and great 3d as well.
the picture fills almost the entire span of the tv with only a very thin bevel around the edges  adding to the experience.

the remote is very small with only a few buttons and not sure we would like it as the prime remote  but use a universal for basic functions and controlling the associated cable box.  in terms of controlling the unique features of the tv such as browser  apps and settings  the remote is great.
it is a bit cumbersome controlling netflix functions  so prefer to use netflix from the blu ray player.
the 3d glasses that come with the tv do not provide consistent operation  however.
it is difficult to pair them to the tv and have not been able to get more than 3 working at the same time.
overall  we atre very pleased with the samsung  and without experience with other 3d tvs  do not know if this is a universal issue with 3d glasses or specific to the samsung.
based on picture quality alone  it is a great buy for the money.

why give an excellent tv 4 stars     some what in depth  i have purchased this tv a month ago and i can say i am very happy with it.
i purchased it with much consideration and scrutiny  like any other man who wants to buy a big tv for the money they put in it.
the background i came from in the tv world are plasma tvs.
as you may  or may not know  they offer the best natural colors and have a true  deep black tone.
i have had 2 plasma tvs  one that i was very happy with and another that i was very disappointed with.
to speak of the first one i owned  it was a samsung plasma tv from 2009.
i had that for 3 years and then was able to finally upgrade to another tv.
my brother has it now and its still going strong aside from it tilting slightly  yet noticeable  on its original stand.
the second purchase was a panasonic p50gt50 smart tv earlier this year  2013 .
i had that tv for about 7 months.
needless to say  its the panasonic that i purchased that was a terrible buy and i am glad they bought it off my hands back.now  stating that background  i am happy with the screen this tv produces.
as you read around about leds  they don t produce the best color depths that are natural.
i would have to say that with this tv  the change is seamless to me and i have yet to do any real adjustments with the screens.
though some would have their adjustments  it all depends on where you live.
my tv is in a dark area and i feel it produces great image for where it is located with its auto lighting adjustment.speaking of the audio system.
first off  you bought a tv  not a sound system.
if anyone ever tries to  review  an audio system  whether by cnet or a  professional   you should stop reading that section and move on to the next  its always a waste of time.
i bought a samsung 550 soundbar.
soundbars in general are the way to go  in my opinion  unless you have the money to fork out for a real 5.1 or 7.1 system.
i am very happy with it  especially the fact that it connects to my tv s remote via samsung s  anynet  connection.
learn it  like it  love it the physical appearance of the tv is very attractive for any setting.
considering the bezel was made thin  it is hardily noticeable  whether watching the tv or not.
now  because the tv is so tall  i suggest bracing it to the wall or wall mounting it or mounting it to an actual entertainment center.
you don t want to swivel it and then.... well its 60  and that s a bit tall to swivel at a small low point if you ask me..
so get some sense  brace it or mount it.
i mounted it to the entertainment center.
its very easy to manage in terms of weight.
i would say though that if you get something this big  a 60   i would suggest to have 2 people to carry it due to its size.
you might be able to manage a 50  or under on your own... but i would never suggest that..the smart interface on this model is excellent
though i have yet to do some of the  more advance  functions such as screen sharing  the applications on the smarthub and the more  simple  apps such as youtube and amazon prime are simple to use.
i love personally how there is a selection square around what app or function you hover over and it indicates as well via sound.

panasonic s smart interface was less then desirable in lacking a selection square in the model previously mentioned  thats why i am pointing this out.now  speaking so highly of a tv  why 4 stars for this tv.
well  the tv is a great tv  but i feel there is some lacking to it in the wifi streaming connection side.
i wish i could post the pictures  but the tv  while obtaining a ping of 71 and 55 for a 2.4g and a 5g connection  only has a download speed of 2.49 and 3.32  again respectively.
i have a connection of 30mb with cable connections  a very good  strong connection from an asus n66u dual band router.
now  before you say  make a bridge stupid  i already tried.
not only that  it actually got worse  a ping between 1000 1200 and a download of 1mb.
and it was another asus dual band router i used for it.
so it actually got worse so now i reverted back to the built in wifi connection and put it on the 5g band.
a little rough with some movies  but for the most part  it still manages to stream hd.
i think samsung should still look into this.

i have no idea whats going on that s wrong.to wrap up  that tv is excellent if you are looking for great image and an overall system that literally allows you to control everything with a small remote  so awesome .
however  due to the fact that it has some kind of streaming cap to the tv  it almost kills the  smart function  making you seek other options.
if it frustrates me enough  i turn on my ps3 and go from there.
i just shouldn t have to go there to get smooth smart applications.
i did pay for a smart tv well that s my two cents
samsung  please update and fix this hiccup.
i like you guys too much and i know you are all smart people over there

great picture  very thin frame bezel  additional samsung remote with buttons eases use.

i love the picture quality  and the very thin frame bezel on this set.it arrived very well packed  and was relatively easy to set up.because the tv is s o o thin  the speakers are also thin  and the resulting sound quality is not that great.that is why i rated it 4 stars instead of 5. a sound bar or additional speakers may be in order for some.the touch pad remote control works pretty well   although the lack of many buttons makes some changes more difficult to do.so i also bought the samsung smart tv remote   model bn59 01054a    which is particularly well made  has back lighting  and easy to use large  flat buttons that all readily work with this set.
it required no programming   just add batteries
i use it in conjunction with the touch pad one and am now quite satisfied.
not plasma but very good for lcd led.
stunning picture quality after some minor calibration.
first i am not a big fan of lcd led televisions   plasma is absolutely better due to higher contrast  wider viewing angles  better screen uniformity  less variation   and truer un exaggerated colors.

i don t know enough about the television industry to fully understand why manufacturers are pulling away from plasma and producing these led lcd televisions almost exclusively  maybe they re just much cheaper to produce  ship and more cost effective on the homeowner to operate over time.

i did a lot of research prior to purchasing this tv   it seems to be the best of the current offerings unless one is willing to spend several thousand dollars on lcd for minor improvements which ironically look more like plasma tvs.

if you purchase this tv expecting it to look like a plasma tv you will be disappointed  if you purchase this tv expecting to own one of the best lcd televisions on the market right now then you will be extremely happy.
much research paid off     good tv.
one month old un46f7100 performs as advertised and as praised on amazon forum.
tuner is excellent for ota.
remote is tedious  i went immediately to logitech universal  thanks to son s programming it  he set up tv  also .
unfortunate that closed captioning is very tough  many steps  to turn on off  using either remote.
nor can i enable it automatically with  mute   handy when the phone rings.movies look great  tv programs as well  but quality of shows has not improved .
sound is fine  was a concern to me .
speakers are on bottom edge  perhaps those who didn t like the sound have mounted their set too close to a surface at the bottom edge.
web link  using ethernet cable  works ok but limited usefulness.
laptop s minidp to hdmi works well.
regular delivery went faster than expected  and protective packaging was excellent.
great picture but so many settings it takes forever to set the colors and picture quality.

without his recommendations i would never even have found most of the picture and color settings.
the manual is good for turning on the tv after that you need to use the remote which i found difficult to use.

the tv itself looks terrific and the picture once you get it set is amazing.
my wife and i watched the 3d version of avatar  using a samsung 6500 3d blue ray player.
we enjoyed the clarity and visuals even more than when we saw it in the theater.
conversion of 2d to3 d was not great but playing 3d movies is a great experience.
overall i would have given the set 5 stars except for the small remote and lack of a helpful manual.
we ordered the tv through amazon and they delivered on time and it was very easy to deal with them.
this tv is large and comes in a box 6 ft long so we needed to have it delivered in rural alabama.
excellent tv   smart features are a gimmick.
this review is for the 55  version of the 7100 series tv.the biggest point i want to make in this review is that the picture quality on this tv is superior to all competition.
if you are looking for a mid high end television but don t want to spend  2 000 or more then seriously consider this tv.
this is my second tv purchase in the past 10 years  my previous set being a 32  samsung lcd which was mid high end back in 2004.

i ll provide three quick high points of the tv and what i look for in making a long term investment in a television.first  the microdimming makes the blacks black and the whites white without washing out colors.

second  glare reduction coating is amazing and is even better than a simple matte finish on some lower end sets  one of the main reasons i ve been so diligent in reasearching televisions is because i have a bay window opposite of my tv that lets in huge amounts of sunlight .
third  game mode  i have been called a cheater and a hacker several times now in the first week of using this tv.

and i can safely say that the 30m s processing time is to blame  people just can t compete in first person shooters.i would highly recommend properly setting up the television before trying to judge or review the tv.
most importantly  turn auto motion plus to standard mode if you re not watching high definition sports  as it just creates a jittery picture  soap opera  effect.
several reviews have posted calibrations that they have used on their sets.

i would use them as a guide and adjust slightly to your liking  because not every screen  room or person is exactly the same.now for the reasons why i took away 1 star  smart features  remote and 3 d.
these are all gimmicks shoved in consumers faces by the major companies  don t purchase a tv based soley on these features.
in regards to the smart features  a good blueray player or playstation 3 4 will render all of the apps sluggish  bland and overall worthless.
next the remote is built on a great idea which isn t executed properly  or technology just isn t ready for intelligent televisions and remotes .
i would recommend using your cable box remote or a universal remote.
finally  3d  it s just a fad.

look at the trend of 3d movies in theaters and you ll see that current 3d technologies aren t going to be the future of movies  gaming or television.closing summary  if you want a tv with the best picture to price ratio on the market right now  this is the tv for you.
forget about the gimmicky features and get this tv  it will impress for years to come and with samsung s track record  it will last for many years.
tv contenders...i m trying to help you here
i will post this in different places i.e samsung  sony  and vizio sections.omg  choosing a car is much easier than a tv.
as most people here  i have spent about 4 weeks solid  reviewing tv s  and stalking them as well.
i have been to bb  hhregg  as well as a few other specialty stores  and spent 2 to 4 hours in each store.
i m retired so i can afford to do so .i have asked the sales people to insert proprietary 3d disks.

the only thing that has not been possible is to attach my xfinity comcast cable box to these tv s to compare the difference in picture quality.the first thing that needs to be said is that none of these stores selling said tv s have calibrated them.
so some tv s that are highly rated on the internet  look terrible in the store.one example is  the panasonic 65  zt series plasma hdtv  which was placed directly in bright lights in the hhregg store.
the poor tv looked lousy and dark...sniff.another thing that you should know about the reviewer  me  is that i have been actively creating 3d objects and graphics for years.
resolution and color representation are so important to me.couple this with the fact that i have light to moderate aspergers.
i can focus on microscopic details and differences for hours.
idiotic perfection of sorts.

it s a blessing and a curse.the contenders we have selected for purchase  within our budget  as of today are  sony 65  xbr series led ultra hdtvsamsung 75  series 7 led hdtv   un75f7100sony kdl 70r550a 70 inch 120hz 1080pvizio m801d a3 80 inch 1080ppanasonic 65  zt series plasma hdtv.as of this writing  we have eliminated the sony kdl 70r550a.

although it is by far the most affordable   2100   the colors and picture quality are simply inferior to the others above.we are also probably going to eliminate the panasonic plasma for whatever reason  the 3d was not amazing  and it s only a 65  screen.if you mention the name vizio to me  i will start getting cold sweats.
although the vizio m series affords plenty of great reviews  i still have a psychological barrier towards stereotypical cheaper brands.
quite frankly  i also have a barriers towards kia and hyundai  although they are great cars.i have had plenty of time to observe the vizio m801d a3 and the vizio m701d a3 in action.
despite my mistrust in the brand  the picture both in 2d and 3d is excellent.
many reviewers  have said that the screen is too reflective and that there are problems operating the remote control on these models though.
the screen on the samsung 75  series 7 led hdtv   un75f7100  is also just as reflective.

the color representation and picture quality of the samsung is superior to the vizio though.anyone who is considering the purchase of a sharp aquos should definitely compare study vizio m models as well.
personally  i would buy the vizio over the sharps  i prefer the vizios image over the sharps  and the sharp 80  is very expensive too compared to vizio.

if anyone here is considering a samsung 7100 or 8000 led  do not even bother checking out the vizios or the sharp models.i hesitated a long time over the samsung models  and when my research was over  i invited my wife to review the results.the 3 models we studied were the samsung 4k ultra   65  and both the un75f7100 and unf8000 both at 75 .i saw very little picture quality difference between the un75f7100 and unf8000  however the 8000 series is much more expensive.
for this reason we eliminated it.my wife and i have apple tv at home  so we are less interested in apps and gaming.
we like watching movies both in 2d and 3d.next we compared the 4k ultra tv s  the sony xbr and the samsung 4k.
both have a 65  screen.for some odd reason we did not find the samsung 4k impressive.
we played a few sony demos on it as well as watched a few 3d movies on it  and it was marginally better than the samsung un75f7100.
also the 4k is more expensive by  2000.the 3d movies we watched were nearly just as good on the un75f7100.

we also found that the un75f7100 had better color representation...wait let me explain    the sony xbr 4k.if money were no object  i would buy the 85  model of the sony xbr 4 k ultra  right now.the sony xbr is by far the best picture quality and especially color representation we have seen.

by far   if you do not believe me  get a few 2d 3d movies you guys like  and go and force the sales people to play them on the sony.sony is reluctant to allow third party content to play on their demo tv s because they want to show you their demo stuff  that looks exceptional btw.
but if you are going to spend 5k on a tv it s your right to be anally retentive.the picture quality  the perfection of color  and the passive 3d blew us away.

this tv does an amazing job at up scaling content to a higher a definition of clarity and color.for me  the difference between the sony and most of the other tv s was like creating a picture in photoshop at 72 pixels per inch and then creating the same picture at 300ppi  then comparing the two.
forget the fact that there is little to no real 4k content yet.
this tv has by far the best picture.the huge dilemma we now have is.
which of these two tv s are we going to buy
the samsung un75f7100 or the sony 4k.
the samsung is much larger  10   but the sony is better quality in picture and color.we found that the samsung un75f7100 was not far behind in color  but there was still a visible difference.
the sony image is much crisper clearer.

a higher definition  no doubt.the samsung screen is much like the vizio  extremely reflective to any object that may be in front of it.we preferred the sony s screen.another dilemma we have is that we view tv from 12 feet away  so logically the 75  samsung would be a better choice.
price wise they are more or less the same given a few hundred dollars.we did find the samsungs stand quite unpractical.
due to the relatively long tv one needs two small tables at either end of the tv.
we cannot wall mount it.the speakers are no doubt better on the sony which has speakers on either side of the screen.

anyhow  all these tv s warrant an added sound bar  so who cares about the original factory sound sony is coming out with the same tv in a few weeks without the speakers  so i may wait until i finally decide which of these two to purchase.hope this review helps you guys choose a tv.

what i like about this tv thin profile and thin bezel.
nice picture  once it is adjusted.what

i do not like .the side viewing angle is somewhat limited  but no so narrow that it s impossible to view from the side.in 3 of the 4 picture modes  the tv uses micro dimming  md  and it can t be turned off.
only the  movie  mode turns the md off.

i find that the md is very distracting and if it weren t for the  movie  mode  i would have sent the tv back.it took me nearly a week of tweaking and fine tuning before the picture color and contrast were acceptable.
getting the contrast right was the most difficult issue.the tv has a digital optical audio output for audio receivers that do not have hdmi inputs.

the problem is that the tv only outputs 2 channel sound from this output  not 5.1 from the sources that are input into the tv  cable box  dvd  etc.   although  it will output 5.1 from the smart apps  like youtube  netfix  etc.
this problem might not be solely unique to this tv  i believe it may be the case with all tvs.
also  the sound picture sync adjustment is not effective when you use the audio optical output  just the sound that is output through the hdmi connection.the inputs for older equipment are limited.
beside the hdmi inputs  you can connect only 1 component video source or 1 composite video source  not both at the same time.

compare and contrast
my girlfriend just gone one of these last night  after we spent quite some time studying the pictures and features of the various tvs in the store.
one of the features that really impressed us about this tv was the contrast range  or dynamic range as you ll call it if you re a photo guy like me .
it s excellent.
well  do you like visually dark movies  like many batman movies  or tim burton s sleepy hollow
this tv will show you things you ve never seen before in those movies.
visually dark movies can be very moving  but at times i ve felt they were hiding too much.
i want to re watch all those movies now with this tv  because sleepy hollow was a whole new  and better  movie.
we re in a digital age  and one way that digital still can t compare to film is dynamic range.
real film can show you more ranges of black or dark gray than most digital formats.

but this tv goes a long way toward changing that  the picture you see is a lot closer to what was recorded on the film.others have commented on the size  clarity  software features  etc.  so i ll just say that overall this seems like a really great tv so far.
but boy  is that contrast range impressive further comments  some people don t like the way the remote works.
i can kind of see why  but my gf says you just need to get used to it.
so there s that  for whatever it s worth.one quirk  a couple of times now  the picture has dimmed a bit.
we did some digging  and apparently this is because of a feature called microdimming.
it only happens under certain picture conditions  like a brightly dressed performer on a dark stage.
now  i can t find that term in the manual.
the word  dimming  takes you to a discussion of the energy saving modes  and we ve turned those off so we ll see if that does anything.
the other reviewer also says microdimming happens in standard mode  so we ve changed it to natural mode.
honestly  if this microdimming is just part of the package  we ll live with it.
the tv is still fantastic.update about 6 months in  we re still marveling at the picture quality.
the remote is a bit quirky  but it s not the end of the world.
this is an awesome tv.
awesome tv but trying too hard.
great tv  super sleek design and beautiful picture would warrant five stars.
however the  annoying smart system is too complex of an interface that makes regular stuff like changing channels a pain in the neck
good tv. a lot of good things about this tv.
it s super easy to set up.
wifi connected easier than other samsung blu ray products.
the thin bevel is amazing.
the tv wasn t much bigger than my old 58 inch  but the image size was because of the thin bevel.
once you adjust the picture settings it looks amazing.
i gave 4 stars instead of 5 because it doesn t come out of box looking amazing.
you have to adjust the picture.
everything has tendency to appear very bright and soap opera esque even though it s a movie or tv show.
very nice picture.
everything looks great after 1 month of ownership.
set up was easy too.i went from a 12 year rear projection unit to this new flat panel  the picture is definately better  but i guess my expectation where a little to high.
i am not disappointed  it is just not the dramatic improvement i was expecting.
i am happy with the unit  but not amazed.
very good product.
awsome picture quality.

fantastic tv for decently lit conditions.
this tv is a beautiful tv and has one of the most gorgeous physical designs i have ever seen on a flat screen tv.
the picture is equally stunning with a fluid picture comparable to the movement of water.

the colors literally leap off the screen and after professional calibration they seem to be very accurate.pros colormotion rate  clarityphysical design..literally like 3 4 of an inch thick at it s thickest pointcons firstly let me explain why i gave this tv a 4 star rating... in a well lit room like with the blinds open or 1 to two laps on the picture is perfect..no issues what so ever.

however if the tv is located in a pitch black room or very low lighted room then you will start to notice the typical crux of edge lit led tvs... the flash lightening or clouding as it is sometimes refereed to.

this means that you can see shadows  or flashlight patterns of light emanating from the corners of the tv pointing towards the center  this effect is usually only noticed in very dark movie scenes or pure black backgrounds.
this flash lighting is literally un noticeable in a decently lit room for example your living room  however in a pitch black room this effect becomes more noticeable.

this effect can be tamed using the setting of standard under the picture options settings but is still noticeable in dark rooms.other the 3d on the tv is impressive  but not worth being the sole reason for purchasing the tv.

the smart features of the tv are pretty impressive but not as fast intuitive as say an apple tv.final verdict picture quality  9 10 due to flash lightingperformance  9 10 due to somewhat sluggish smart features   which are still the best smart features to be integrated in a tv design  10 10 beautiful minimalist design  razor slim  clean appearance  awesome remote controli would recommend it to anyone.

this product would get five stars if it wasn t for the software.i am reasonably techno literate but by the end of the weekend i spent trying to set up the absolutely awful samsung allshare software i was ready to give up.
i have a simple network with a nas box which stores most of my digital content.

i connected the tv to the network without a hitch and it recognized everything on the network without a problem  it even correctly identified the other stbs in the house and my sonos system  but when i attempted to navigate to the content all i got was a  no content available on this device  message.
no  you must install allshare software to be able to view content on your tv  or any other helpful message.

there was no cd in the box and no instructions anywhere in the documents supplied with the tv  yes i checked and yes i am sure    it was only when i went online and looked at the 500  page manual did i figure out that i needed to install the allshare software to be able to stream content.fair enough i suppose but wouldn t you then think that the software would be available for download from samsung s site
i navigated to the model specific webpage and chose  downloads    nothing.
i searched the site.
i found a few helpful posts from others in my situation but the links they posted to the download sites were dead.
i finally managed to download a copy of the current version of allshare from a third party mirror site and that s where the fun began.the allshare product simply does not work.
it doesn t work.
ca ne marche pas.
first off it doesn t completely install   the installshield wizard hangs and if you terminate the process it will start up normally.

second the ui looks as if it was written by prisoners of war and is utterly unintuitive   there are no real  help  screens to speak of and everything is written in insider buzzwords so figuring out how to configure the software is a challenge.
but all that aside  the product simply fails to recognize content and stream it to your tv.

i spent a very frustrating evening trying to get it to work and ultimately had to give up and download a copy of serviio which worked right away in the first install.i know samsung fancy themselves as giving apple a real run for its money.
maybe that s true on the hardware side but the software is dreadful.
by all means buy this tv but do not even waste your time with the allshare  software product
great tv  not perfect.
pros 1  movies and shows look stunning on normal and 3d television.2
slim and modern look.3
has access to a lot of apps.4
it recognizes just about any type of picture and video files through a usb.cons 1  the 3d glasses often disconnect.2
the wi fi disconnects from time to time.3
the user interface should be more customizable.4
the control remote takes some getting used to.i purchased the samsung f7100 tv on a black friday sale last year.
ever since the delivery arrived it has monopolized my viewing time.
i barely use my other  dumb  tvs anymore.
between the amazing and pleasurable viewing experience and the convenience of a vast array of apps directly available from the tv i see no need for my other tvs.
my experience with the tv has been very positive but it has come with a few minor stumbles along the way.

i intend to go a little deeper into both the pros and cons and hope this review helps you decide whether this model is right for you.pros  continuation 1  when i went looking for a new tv for my living room i was looking for a high end tv that would not break the bank.
i was looking for something close to theater experience when it came to 3d movies.
i am a huge fan of 3d movies and all i can say is that this tv does not disappoint.
the movies look pretty amazing.
i dare to say they look just as good as the theater.
with that said  most of the television i do watch is normal regular tv.
i watch a lot of netflix and youtube on the tv and for the most part all of the videos look fantastic.
some of the videos on youtube look grainy but that is because of the native resolution of the video itself  it has nothing to do with the tv.
i am not an expert and i don t pretend to be.
all i know is that the picture quality is very  very good and the tv looks noticeable better than the other lcd tvs i have in my house.2
one of the things that make this tv so appealing is its slim profile.
the tv is a real looker.
everyone that has been to my house instantly notices it.
it is honestly hard not to.
you have a tv that is 55  big and is about an inch thick.
the bezels are extremely small too.
when you are watching it you are pretty much looking all screen.
my other tv by comparison has a 52  inch screen and is 7  inches longer due to the wide bezels.
it honestly looks like a dinosaur in comparison.
there is not much more to say here  samsung nailed it in the aesthetic department.
if you are still not convinced go to your local electronic store and take a look at it for yourself.
you will be blown away.3
another aspect of the tv that i really like is having access to all of my favorite apps without having to hook up a computer or a set up box.
i like having access to all of it in a single controller.
no more having to deal with a keyboard or mouse to have access to netflix or youtube directly from your tv.
all of the big apps are available for free on the play store and most of them work without any problems.
i have seen netflix  youtube  pandora  hulu  amazon  spotify and many other ones.
the only one i wish was available was the google music app.
i believe that one is only available on lg tvs.
it is pretty simple to navigate the apps with the remote controller.
the only exception is when i am trying to locate a specific video on youtube.
it is annoying and time consuming to search letter by letter on the remote control.
fortunately  you can use your smartphone or tablet that has the youtube app to  cast  the video on the tv.
it works just like with the google chromecast.
it is very easy to use and my phone connects flawlessly with the tv.4
i have a lot of old dvds that i have ripped and have digital copies of them on my computer hard drive.
i have saved many of them on a usb and have tested them on the tv.
it has recognized every single type of file i have thrown at it.
i love being able to see all my pictures and videos any time without the need of a dvd player.
it is a very convenient feature and one i was unaware of when i purchased the tv.cons  continuation 1  the biggest issue i had by far with this tv has been the 3d glasses.
the tv come with a set of 4 glasses.
the model number of the glasses is ssg 5100gb.
they are total garbage.
they sometimes take a good minute to detect that the tv is playing a 3d movies.
but that would not be that much of an issue if they would stay connected.
you start watching a movie and if you move your head too often the glasses disconnect themselves.
extremely irritating when you are trying to watch a fast pace movie and you get a blurred screen in the middle of it because you decided to look down for a second.
most of the time that they disconnect you have to go ahead turn them back on and pray that they reconnect quickly.
my friend bought the 65  inch model of this exact same tv and he got a different model of 3d glasses that are much  much better.
they connect themselves instantly and they stay connected at all times.
i have considered buying a different model to replace the factory ones.
i don t know if maybe samsung has replaced the factory models.
just do your research on what model of 3d glasses the tv comes with.
if it is this one then be prepare to deal with this headache.2
in a few occasions while watching netflix i have had the tv suddenly lose internet connection.
when it has happened i have quickly resolved the issue by unplugging and reconnecting my router.
it does not happen often but it has happened on more than one occasion and i have not been able to find another solution.
i have over 10 devices connected to the same router and the only one that has this problem is this tv.
maybe it is some sort of compatibility problem but it is not bad enough for me to consider buying another router.
it is just a mild annoyance that happens about once a month or so.
not that big of a deal but something you need to keep in mind.3
before purchasing this tv in particular i did some research regarding its  smart  features.
i saw a lot of complaints about the user interface.
unfortunately  a lot of those complaints are correct.
the user interface could really use some improvements.
what i specifically dislike is that it feels inflexible.
there is no area to group the different applications or even to rearrange the order.
the layout has five home screens similar to what you find on your phone or tablet.
but you cannot rearrange the order of the home screens or even the default home screens.
i do not understand why tv manufacturers have decided to remain so inflexible in these aspects.
it would have been nice if they would have at least included some way to at least bookmark your preferred apps.
it is really a shame.
maybe in a couple more generations they will improve this.4
my final issue with the tv is its remote control.
the remote is not terrible by any means but it does take a bit to get used to it.
the only thing i don t like is that it does not have physical buttons to change the channels.
instead you have to press the  more  button on the remote that will give you a virtual remote on the screen that will let you change to a specific channel.
i had another samsung remote control that i use it to change the channels when i decided to do so.in conclusion  would i recommend this tv to someone
the main function of a tv is to obviously watch television and in this respect the tv is simply outstanding.
the screen is beautiful and so is the aesthetic design of the tv.
just keep in mind that just like every other product in the market it has its flaws.
in my case the 3d glasses have been a pain in the behind at times but not enough to question my decision to buy the tv.
after all  i only watch 3d maybe 5  of my total time.
the minor issues i had with the wi fi have been few and far in between and it is probably going to vary depending on your internet connection and the equipment you have installed.
if you took this long to read this review then i would like to thank you for doing so and i hope it has helped you on your search for a new tv.
also if you have any specific question please don t hesitate to ask it on the comment section and i will try to answer it to the best of my abilities.
good luck on your search.

was going to be a replacement for a sony bravia  but ended up putting in the basement to be the  center piece  of the family room.3d up scaling is decent   have not had a 3d tv previously and have not watch 3d on other home tv s so i can not accurately compare this feature.thin  light  great picture  some tweaking required  sound   not so great but most would use a sound system of some kind to give a complete audio experience.great shipping   the delivery men were nice and helpful.
nice so far  but the defaults are an issue.
edit  adding this to the top   i m sure this is in other reviews  but i found that to turn offsoap opera effect  set auto motion plus off.
it s located a menu picture ..scroll down and click on picture optionsand it s in that sub menu.
yet another poorly chosen default.

love the tv though.my wife and i moved the 50 inch flat screen to the mbr and my wife was huffing and puffing afterward.so naturally she was getting prepared for the extra weight of the 65  samsung when she and iwere pleasantly surprised at how much lighter it is than our 50  which is only several years old.
instructions for connecting the base were misleading.
it told me to lay the tv face down andafter assembling the foot  attach it to the tv  but it doesn t show that you have to lift the one sideof the tv up about 10 inches to attach it.
i know that everybody will figure that out  but it s irritating thatthe tech writer just ignores that part of the instruction.
and about that four pronged foot.
i really preferthe look of the typical solid base because we have a giant nice wood home theatre enclosure that the stainlesslook sort of clashes with.
this unit looks like it should rest on a clear glass or stainless steel mount of some kind.
the setup was very easy  connecting to dish and my local internet no problem.
if that is used to view the tv while browsing channels  then the default setting of tiny tvand giant channel icons doesn t do any good.
seems there s plenty of room on the screen to makethe picture larger and still have channel surfing.
i also didn t like that it defaults to the smart tv thingy.i didn t know how to get out of the damn thing and how to get to the regular channel display.
hitting enterworked several times  but once it didn t.
i kept hitting the enter key and the picture remained small.i went into picture setup and turned off that  feature .
in my opinion  it should be off to start with.
at thefactory  one could argue that if you make it the default  then folks will know about it and just fall in love with it.

but  i prefer the lineof thought that you want the tv to work first time as seamlessly as possible to make a good impression and be easy to get up.if people want that feature  they ll search it out and figure it out.
so  instead of being impressed by it  i was thoroughly annoyed by it to start with.
second annoying thing is what i see folks are calling the soap opera effect.
i did not know how to getrid of that for the first movie we watched except to set to  movie  mode instead of standard.
but even that didn tdo much to get rid of it.
i m going to try settings that other folks have listed in these reviews and hope they know whatthey re doing.

so  our first 3d movie was essentially in soap opera mode which was the second bad first time impression.seems to me that samsung would have learned this a long time ago to have some simple settings that work forwhat most people like.
read these reviews and you see that they have failed miserably  not with the product but withthe marketing of it due to defaults and simple settings.
out of the box first impressions get a 2 or 3 star from me.
a small annoying thing that i still don t know if there s a fix for is that  dink  noise that the volume control makes.
the louder you make the sound  the louder that dink noises becomes.
it is extremely annoying at high  movie volume .
i hope there s a way to disable that but i have not found it under the sound section of the tv setup.
i also hope there s a way to make the volume increments less granular.
seems there was on one of my two 50 inch tv s.
about 3d.
the instructions were not very clear how to set it up.
the instructions didn t say to remove the plastic protectivepieces from the glasses.
ok  that s a no brainer  but it would be nice if samsung were thorough.
i found the glasses rather difficultto assemble.
the sides that had to be  clicked  onto the front did not go in very easily.
in fact  it took a great deal of force on my part to get that to happen on two of them.
the glasses didn t work after registered successfully with the tv the first time.
it said it had registered on the screen  but 3d didn t work.
i registered again both sets of glasses  then it worked.
i also didn t know of the difference between passive and active 3d.
while viewing  i expected something to jump out at us like disney or epcot.
come to find out from reading these reviews  the  jumping out at you  effect is more a feature of passive 3d and this tv has active 3d.
having said all this  we really enjoyed the 3d movie and the effects of it.
to me  the movie had great 3d depth but the images seemed to start at the tv and go behind the tv rather than coming forward like maybe passive 3d would do.
it was very  very impressive even in that darned soap opera mode.
the glasses were comfortable for me  but my wife like some other reviewers found them to be very uncomfortable to wear.
i m curious how long the batteries will last and wish these were rechargeable.
i hope i can find batteries that fit that are rechargeable.
i was pleased that this tv came with 4 pairs and that those were not optional.
we bought the samsung 3d blue ray player to go with this unit and since we own the samsung 2d blue ray  i d like to say that both interfaces for that unit are equally confusing.
to this day i don t know what the logic is behind the interface that gets in my way of the dvd interface.
you know  the globe icon and other stuff.
i realize they want to act like a roku player  but having all that stuffbe the default like the smart tv thingy just serves to annoy and confuse me.
it is as though an engineer has worked his way into a high level product management position.
he or they need to go back to the engineering department where they belong.
or  and i ve seen this a number of times in my life  the ceo dictated the defaults.
but  as a consumer  i think some of the product management marketing decisions for this product are all wrong.
so far  the setup was relatively easy but clumsy as stated above.
the picture looks good  but i suspect it will look much better after adjusting it like other folks have had to do.
just like my latent  undiscovered benevolent dictator skills  if i were running samsung  these stupid setup problems wouldn t be a problem.
you can t please everybody  but if i ran the show  most of the negative comments i see here would not be found in these reviews.
i ll add to this review once i really get to know the tv.so far i like it.
does built in wi fi mean wi fi ready    great pic but tough to configure settings   some features difficult to figure out.
i purchased the samsung 46  7100 w  built in wireless  a must have for my purchase   set it up   was very pleased   wireless feature working and all.
set up was easy....the stand  connecting to cable  turning the tv on  etc. settings were not fun but i don t know if that is due to my lack of tech ability or the tv is difficult  or both .
i am able to muddle my way through to a fairly awesome picture  which i would give 4 5 stars for.
i recently moved   the tv will not even recognize my home network let alone get to a screen to enter the network password.
all other devices....notebooks  tablets  cell phones  printer recognize the home network right away.
i called samsung support today and the rep informed me that my tv is only wi fi ready i need to purchase a lan adapter.
he explained that my tv must have recognized the internet at my last home but not at my new home.
is this for real
and if so  why on earth don t the ads  manual  sales people tell us these things.
geeeesh  i think it s easier to shop for a new vehicle than a tv these days
other than this wi fi issue   the same issues with settings  codes  etc. being frustrating as mentioned by other reviewers i love the picture this tv provides.
it has super clarity  motion is great whether watching football or a classic western in b w.
this is my first samsung tv  i ve always purchased sony bravia but  when shopping this time the samsung seemed to offer the same features for less   .
i am giving only 3 stars due to the difficulty with the settings.
trying to work with all of the wonderful features this tv offers has been a complete drag.
i can usually play around w  most devices   figure things out pretty quickly...and will read the manual if i need to  lol.
the samsung has proven to be a challenge for me regardless.
i am still on the fence as to which i prefer but so far i m leaning toward my first love  the sony bravia.
i have yet to set up the 55  sony bravia i have but hoping built in wi fi doesn t mean  oh yah  but with adapter  for that tv as well
worried about samsung customer service   buy from local retailer.
picture on this and other models owned by my family i d rate as 5.  service  i d rate as 2 or 3 stars out of 5.  i purchased this tv  the 7050 model  from a local retailer.
it was by far the best picture available short of the 4k model  for which there is little if any programming .
the first set i took home had 6   8 gray bard radiating up vertically from top to bottom whenever the screen was black or letter boxed    very disturbing.
whenever the screen was completely full of color  the picture was fine.
but when vertical bars radiate from  the bottom on a macbook  it means the led screen or bar at the bottom of the screen is going bad.
i called samsung and talked with someone who appeared to be little more knowledgable than a minimum wage worker.
she instructed me to run the self diagnostics  which i d already done .
since the screen on the self diagnostic  picture is completely full of color  the problem did not appear.
so she said she would have someone from tech support  or some such department  call me.
when i asked how long it would take  she said 24 hours.
i told her there was no way i was going to wait 24 hours for help  or to have a brand new set that had been plugged in for 2 days repaired.
i said if someone could call me within an hour and perhaps tell me how to change the settings or otherwise correct this problem  i d be willing to wait.
she said it would still be 24 hours.
so i took it back to the local retailer who without any fuss exchanged it for another new  in box  set.
the new set has been working well  knock on wood  for 2 days and the picture is fantastic.
i have a smaller samsung  last year s model  as does my son.
both sets have performed well.
but  i am a concerned that samsung s service is lacking.
i hope that if and when i need it  it s better than  someone will call you in 24 hours.
great 3d experience.
i am a 3d junkie  but i use the tv mostly in 2d   as will most everyone who gets one.
i love everything about the tv except the following my biggest complaint is with batteries in the 3d glasses.
i hate that.
since i do not use the 3d feature often  i do not keep the batteries in the glasses  but rather install them before use.
and then i have to get the glasses turned on before i can use them.
i really wish i had purchased a tv with passive glasses.

also   and this is huge   the glasses need to  turn on  when viewing 3d content and there is a delay of a couple seconds   and this is disconcerting   especially when switching between 2d and 3d content.
really   for me this is a reason i would have purchased a different model tv.second biggest complaint is that the menu system is overly complicated   too many features most of which will not be used.
ok for me   i have a masters in ee   but my wife will never be able to operate the thing.
i want to be able to turn it on  pick a source  cable   dvd   amazontv   usb   etc.  and go.
but they are trying so hard to sell content that it offers a ton of options and these make is so complicated that many will never be able to use it.
i purchased the samsung dvd player to go with the tv and i love that it switched to dvd automatically as soon as i insert a dvd into the dvd slot.

not sure how the tv knows  but maybe my wife will have a chance with this.but then there is the problem that the menus for the tv and the dvd player are the same and i sometimes don t know which i am looking at on the tv screen.
i am sitting there clicking the tv remote  but looking at the dvd remote.

actually  i think that both remotes are supposed to work with both units  but i have not taken the time to figure this all out.when i try to access netflix using the tv  which is cool  i admit   there is a significant wait  15 30 seconds   for the netflix application to load  i could also run netflix from the samsung dvd player which also makes me wait.
so i purchased an amazon fire tv unit which does not make we wait   at least not after the first time.
also  roku does not make we wait.
anyway  here are 4 ways for me to watch netflix on my system   and my wife is supposed to understand this
i think i will have to make up  laminated operating instructions for her.
and she is a very smart woman   senior business executive  but not patient with tech.i have a fuji 3d camera.

the tv knows how to handle the 3d photos from this camera and this is great  but i see a noticeable flicker when viewing them  but i can live with this  but why can t it be as beautiful as when viewing a blue ray 3d dvd   also  it will not display the 3d videos taken by the camera without first converting them to a different format.so mostly i am very happy with the tv   except that i wish i had purchased a tv that uses passive glasses rather than active glasses.

we received the tv on the promised ship date.
however we were not able to get past the 1st step to using the tv.
first step is to attach the stand to the tv using supplied screws.
the screws supplied would not work with the base.
after 5 phone calls to samsung  a rep decided we had the wrong screws and said he would send the correct ones that day.
two and a half weeks later we still didn t have the screws.
after numerous calls to samsung and local samsung repair shops  we could not get the specs on the screws required to acquire them from a hardware store.
after 3 weeks we received another base  exactly like the 1st one  with 2 packets of screws.
one packet was the same as originally sent and the other was the correct screws we quickly got the base attached and set up the tv.
it worked like a champ.
our only complaint is that provided remote control is very difficult to use and is feature poor.
we still have to use our directv remote for most functions.
the most annoying thing is trying to tune to a particular station without having to scroll down the entire list of stations.
also we have a security camera programmed to be on channel 17  and there is no way to get to 17 with the samsung remote.samsung gets zero stars for the base   wrong screws fiasco.
the tv would have gotten 4 stars if the remote was usable.
buyer beware

excellent smart 3d hdtv but structurally fragile.
i recent bought this tv to replace my 5 years old sony lcd tv.
i must say that samsung has done a great job with this tv.
the default setting for color  to my personal preference  is not what i prefer so additional tweak and it looks great now.
the build of the tv is some what fragile not as sturdy as what i used to see 4 5 years back.
you can turn to the left or right for better viewing angle but this needs to be carefully done  otherwise  you can really break the plastic that holds the tv to the stand
i guess  you get what you pay for.
smart tv options is fairly good except the remote is somewhat annoying to use but i will get use to it somehow.
web browser is ok  not that fast since this tv has dual core processor not the quad one but enough for my usage which not that much.
the price is reasonable especially tv low price guarantee by amazon which helps me get the lowest price within 14 days of shipping
what a great  deal  i give 3 stars on the build and remote but 5 stars for the picture quality and other options so average that out is 4 stars.
had i known all this  i would buy this tv any how.more  i finally managed to set up the ir so i can use only one remote to control the cable box.
though samsung remote can do the minimum required activities so you can jump around from one channel to the other.
one nice thing is that it keeps the history so you do not have to enter the channel number in  just select from the history list.

pretty convenience.more on picture quality  the picture is crisp  clear  sharp  etc... it is so good that now i can see all the details enough to realize that whether they shot the movie on location or in the studio.
i did not really notice this with my old hdtv
as a tv great  everything else is crap.
as strictly a tv  this tv is great.
however  i did not spend extra money to get  smart  features and then not even be able to use them.the youtube app  90  of what people use smart tvs for  is completely unusable.
it is so slow and freezes constantly.
with a samsung phone synced to this  screen share has to stop and buffer constantly.
how is it that my iphone can play videos with better quality than my smart tv also  the remote that comes with this tv is a compete piece of crap.

not only does it no longer come with a keyboard so you have to use arrows to find every individual letter  older models had a keyboard on the back of the remote   but it also has a really stupid touch screen track pad that you will accidentally touch about 50x a day which will drain the battery at an excessive rate.
i have already changed the batteries 3 times to this tv in 6 months.if it weren t a  smart  tv  this would be the best tv i have ever owned.
definitely 5 stars.

but honestly at this point i would return it if i could because i get so aggravated every time i want to show someone a youtube video and have to play it on my iphone when there is a 60   smart  tv in front of me.
what samsung doesn t tell you about the un60f7100 tv. is how frustrating their overly complex interface and clumsy user experience can be.
one reason for choosing the samsung un60f7100 tv was access to both netflix and amazon instant video  both of which have dedicated buttons on the remote.
amazon requires a 5 digit code from the tv.
that proved difficult to obtain.
contact with tech support revealed that to use either netflix or amazon instant video  one absolutely must create a samsung account and set up the smart hub.
the two documents one must agree to appear to be very intrusive.
one must read them line by line   not page by page and there s no scanning or skipping portions of no concern.
one must agree that all information  including credit card    name  address  phone  etc.  not sure about wi fi password  can be transmitted internationally and used by anyone samsung deals with.
there was no indication how long the docs were or what percentage i d read.
i lost patience after a few screens and perhaps a hundred button pushes.
i couldn t find them on samsung s website or with a quick web search.next  tech support.
tech support was very slow and uncertain  repeating to me questions i d already answered  with long pauses to research how to set up amazon.
try unplugging the set and waiting 30 seconds. i found online documentation to be lengthy and difficult to read and search.
there is help on the tv  but the crappy remote is required to navigate it.

speaking of which  the touchy little touch pad on the remote is required to navigate menus for common and frequent actions such as changing the picture size or activating closed captioning.the web browser is slow to render and scroll  difficult to navigate and basically useless.

unless the remote is on a solid table  pressing the center of the touch pad to select something causes the cursor to jump off target so that you select something else and have to back up and try again.
then there s the difficulty of typing with it on the tv s virtual keyboard.
an old wired keyboard helped  but the touch pad was the last straw for web browsing.the tv  is  lightweight  attractive and loaded with features.
i have no complaints about the picture  but admittedly i m not very picky about picture quality.
i found recommended settings on the web  augmented by the thx setup from a blu ray disc.
here too  the remote is irritating.
one swipe on the touch pad changes only a few points on a hundred point scale  so setting things like contrast and sharpness takes longer than necessary.
the screen is quite mirror like but ok in our room.
a bit of dark tape over the shiny x stand reduced reflections from it.
i see some flat black paint in its future.so why keep the tv
i had resigned myself to re boxing it and returning it  but my spouse counseled otherwise.
our second choice sony kdl 55w900a is five inches smaller and more expensive  plus this was the second un60f7100 we d unboxed and set up.
the first unit arrived doa and had to be exchanged.
neither of us looked forward to a third installation.
samsung 1  users 0.ultimately  we ignored all of samsung s smart features  browser  etc.
it s now just a nice display with an irritating remote.
hopefully  there s an app for that.
we accessed amazon instant video on the playstation 3 instead  where setup was easy.
even including a system update  playstation account setup and amazon app download  the ps3 was far easier and faster to use than the samsung.
netflix appears to be similar.
the ps3 amazon interface is zippy and intuitive.
i wish i d chosen that path initially.
roku would have been third choice.
if you value your time  they re not making more of that   as i do  perhaps it s worth looking beyond this samsung un60f7100 tv.

hope that s useful.it turned out that the ps3 remote handles all the basic tv functions except 3d and does so more easily and quickly than the touch pad remote.three months later  i like the tv less   too much nannying.
the tv won t let me step past an input whose source has recently powered off until i respond to a prompt   this while trying to select a different input whose source is on.
troubleshooting a loose connection with hands buried in a maze of wires is similarly irritating.
also  the tv shuts itself off inexplicably  typically while the dvr is paused for a few moments.
nothing in the setup seems to prevent this.
love the features and picture however ...get an extended warranty    other people have given great reviews for this product s picture and features  and i do agree that this tv is pretty outstanding.

my review however  is to offer advice about getting an extended warranty using my case s  as an example.i ve owned a previous samsung plasma tv and had it for under 2 years when it developed magenta banding across the screen.
i even wrote a review about it under samsung pn58c500.
since it was out of warranty by only a few months mind you  i was out of luck and had to pay for repairs out of pocket.
the repairman said it would cost     to get the panel fixed so basically  1800 went down the drain.
we vowed never to get another samsung again.
we went shopping for a new tv to replace it and saw this baby.
even though my husband and i swore off samsung because of the issues with our plasma tv  we fell in love with it because the picture looked awesome compared to the other tvs in the store.
we thought long and hard about it  and in the end decided to give samsung another try.we purchased the un65f7100 tv on 8 19 13.
about 8 days later  my son was watching it when it suddenly turned off  made a loud buzzing sound  started smelling like burnt something  and now will no longer turn on.

this tv is 8 days old    it s still under the manufacturer s warranty obviously  but given our past 2 circumstances with samsung  i would advise anyone  do not purchase a samsung tv without an extended warranty.
the reliability of these expensive tv s are terrible  and doing a simple google search will show you that an extended warranty is well worth the investment.
we ve decided to get a 4 year warranty on top of the existing one year manufacturer s warranty because we have little faith in the longevity of any samsung tv.
very nice smart tv.
i just recently purchased this 46  to replace my 2009 samsung e6000 model unit into my bedroom.

big difference is the display quality is nice and bright but my samsung plasma pn64e7000 that i use on my living room is excellent in terms of quality of the picture especially to movies.i bought the tv because it is smart so i dont have to use much of my roku  but the apps are a little sluggish.
i really thought the dual core would be good enough to run the apps smoothly but it didnt.
which makes me wonder why my plasma tv apps run smoothly and it has a dual core processor also.

playing a movies on your usb thumb drive is also excellent as it picks up  sub  extension file  if your re watching foreign movies and the it can play 1080p downloaded movies  which failed on my old tv.the remote control is cool and slim and has a touchpad.

i use a samsung keyboard w  touchpad on my pn64e7000 unit but this one seems to do the work fairly good enough.i have not use the 3d since my 3d bluray player is connected in my living room so i cant comment on that one yet.the tv interface is much cooler than the 2012 style it is easier to scroll from tv to hdmi to samsung apps.
its good for the price.
i chose this rating based on the processing performance of the tv.

the picture is beautiful but  i am not impressed at all with the general processing of simple tasks such as logging into  opening apps such as netflix and facebook or just switching between them in smarthub.
i am also disappointed that i was unable to access or use amazon instant streaming.
i haven t used the 3d or watched enough 3d blu rays to give a review on that aspect just yet.
the physical design of the tv though does deserve a nod of approval it is truly ultra slim and the finish is very stylish.
i would recommend this tv based on my experience thus far but only if the quad core versions are out of your price range.
that is  hoping the quad core processor makes a difference in overall performance.
